catalog_info.title: Language and Prehistory
catalog_info.prereq: Course open to Freshman Students Only
catalog_info.description: Explores use and misuse of linguistic evidence.  The 19th-century identification of the Indo-European language family misled some intellectuals to posit the now rejected idea of a genetically and culturally superior Aryan "race."  Linguistic evidence still plays an important role in studies of the past.  What does the fact that languages are related tell us about their speakers?  How can genuine cases of linguistic borrowing or "influence" be distinguished from resemblances that come about through pure chance?
